meanings.sent1: The prisoner was considered parolable after serving a portion of their sentence.
meanings.sent2: The judge determined that the offender was parolable and could be released early.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a parolable criminal attending a dance party is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes of being parolable from her responsibilities were dashed when more work piled up.
meanings.sent5: The concept of being parolable from homework on weekends sounded like a dream come true.

meanings.definition: Able to be released on parole.
meanings.sent1: The inmate's good behavior made them parolable according to prison regulations.
meanings.sent2: Being parolable meant the individual had a chance to reintegrate into society sooner.
meanings.sent3: It's strange to think of a parolable pet cat roaming the neighborhood freely.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a parolable book escaping the library and exploring the world is intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a parolable balloon floating away symbolized freedom and escape.
